alert.note: Alert for South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 25 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following areas, in Big Bend Florida, Coastal Bay. In Panhandle Florida, Calhoun, Central Walton, Coastal Gulf, Holmes, Inland Bay, Inland Gulf, Jackson, North Walton, South Walton and Washington. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional heavy rainfall is expected to develop later today and tonight and spread across the Florida Panhandle through Thursday morning. An additional 2.5 to 3.5 inches of rain is expected to fall through Thursday afternoon within the watch area, with locally higher amounts possible. This may lead to dangerous Flash Flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
